revised_title: Life History Traits and Genetic Diversity in Plant Species
tldr: This article examines the effects of life history traits, such as breeding system, seed dispersal mechanism, life form, and geographic range, on genetic diversity in plant species. The study finds that these traits have significant influences on genetic variation and its distribution among plant populations. The results provide insights into understanding the genetic makeup of plant species and their adaptation to different environments.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
